column4: His monitor isn't showing anything, I figured getting ssh to work would at least let us have some interaction
yeah, but Ubuntu doesn't install sshd by default
He installed it blind from a tty :) ( hopefully it worked )
We did that, he didn't see anything but we hopefully installed ssh from there.
envy-ng is well written and available in universe, it is not just a random poorly written script
it does a good job of looking like a random poorly-written script
I believe Alberto Milone is also a regular Ubunut developer, and again it is available in the repositories ( though universe, not main )
My ATI card supports all resolution, 3D acceleration, compiz ( with redirected direct rendering using newer drivers ) all with the Free drivers
you're the first person I've ever heard of with the open drivers working
On Ubuntu the grub menu is hidden when Ubuntu is the only OS, you have to hold shift to see it.
I don't know why it didn't happen for you, but that *is* the default for systems with only one OS (Ubuntu) installed.]
bigger things to worry about that that, tbh

The bug that brady linked to, http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=45263 refers to a bug which causes code dealing with serial communication to fail on certain devices (this is not about programming of the chip, as I first thought when I saw serial mentioned). That bug however has been fixed in the version of avr-gcc that brady is using (according to the bug report) but brady still thinks that they need to use an ...
